moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5 4. c3 a5: bad move , the main idea is to fight for the center and develop pieces . popular moves in this positions are 4...Nf6, Bb6,d6. now white have great Chance to control the center totally .
moves.5. d4 exd4 6. cxd4 Bb4+ 7. Nc3 d6 8. h3: the idea is to avoid Bg4 and preparing o-o
moves.8... Nf6 9. Qc2 Bxc3+ 10. bxc3: black must to exchange the bishop on c3 because of his weak position on b4 , white threats Nd5 Nxd5 a3 and bishop is lost
moves.10... h6 11. O-O O-O 12. Ba3: there is no alternative for the bishop to stay on c1-h6 diagonal , on a3 it have better option of development
moves.12... Na7:
preparing b5 but , leaving the center and the movement of the pawn b5 and Bb7 its to slow and helps the white go forward and make bigger advantage by 13. e5!
it was better to move 12....Re8
moves.13. e5 Nh7: look how poor the black position collapse,
moves.15. Nxg5 Qxg5 16. exd6 cxd6 17. Bxd6 Re8: the black bishop can'not take the pawn on f3 because (17...Bxh3?? .18.f4!-Qg3.19.Rf3 and the blck bishop is traped )
moves.18. Be5: closing the  E-line for the Rooke there is no contarplay for black
moves.18... Be6: 18...Bd7 was more effective some how but still the white is much better .
moves.19. f4 Qd8 20. f5 f6 21. fxe6 fxe5 22. B: good move , take another pawn on e5 is to soon because the dobele pawns e5,e6 are weak  , anyway blacks move .22....Qb6+23.Kh1 -Qxe6. now by Bc4 white threting to cpture the Queene on d8 by e7+
moves.22... Re7 23. Qg6: its very hard to defend the black king now
moves.24... Rxf7 25. exf7+ Kf8 26. Re1: black resigns , because he cant avoid loosing his queen ,if 26....Qd7 or c8 it really doesn't matter because of .27. Qh7 and mate on the next move
